data.title: Mesmerizing architecture!
data.text: I went there to attend a session of my conference and was amazed by the architectural design of the building.

data.title: Very informative and entertaining
data.text: We learned a lot about Texas from this visit. The interactive displays were very good, the films an eye opener.

data.title: Great architecture!
data.text: It is a great historic structure. I'm glad it is being maintained in good shape. There are free outdoor music events most Saturday mornings at the courthouse.

data.title: The perfect place for a perfect wedding.
data.text: Our son and daughter in law just got married on the courthouse lawn. Everything was absolutely beautiful and they even provided security to make sure that the area was secure from outside people. I couldn't imagine anything better. Whether you are looking for a place to go visit some history or like my family you are looking for a place to have that perfect even. This is the place!

data.title: Simply Quaint
data.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my visit. It showed a side to Denton and surrounding cities/neighborhoods that I would not have known otherwise. It lacks the extravagance of big city museums, but it still draws you in none the less. The interactive displays were especially enjoyable. I recommend it!

data.title: Small town museum, big town quality
data.text: With regular exhibit changes this museum never gets boring. The quality of local history is outstanding and the Docents are helpful and friendly.

data.title: Interesting and FREE!
data.text:
We decided to check out the town square of Denton for the first time and headed straight for the courthouse. Very easily identified, sitting quite stately in the middle of town. Had to drive around the block to find a parking spot, no meter, but make sure you heed signage to back in on some of those diagonal spots down the block. It was a little problematic lifting our stroller up the steep steps, but I think we entered via a side door and not sure if there is a ramp elsewhere. 
We only perused the first floor which reeks of historic charm. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Exhibits were rather sparse, yet they did invoke a sense of "the old days" and what the area was like well before its current state.  We would go again with other family members, and make sure to stop across the street for a scoop of  delicious home made ice cream!

data.title: There is a lot of cool history inside the courthouse.
data.text: I never realized how many cool "artifacts" are inside the courthouse on the square. I took my son to the square to catch Pokemon, because they are all around the courthouse, but we went inside and were impressed by all the facts and Memorabilia.

data.title: Great place to play Pokemon Go
data.text: I was there the other night.  Several Poke Stops and a lot of people  playing Pokemon Go.  It's really fun.  We stopped and got an ice cream at the local favorite ice cream parlor on the square.  Denton square has no chains!  It's all about local businesses.  Check it out.

data.title: One of the best small museums in the state
data.text: Exhibits are well designed and informative and are changed often to make a second visit worthwhile. The Courthouse has also been beautifully restored, be sure to see the courtroom that is still in use by the country commissioners.

data.title: Historical place
data.text:
Nice place to visit, you will certainly find historical information about the town, agriculture, other historical places, founders, etc.
Sad to see that people have placed Pokemon figures in the windows of this beautiful Courthouse. :(

data.title: Excellent
data.text: What a great place to hang around with the kids... folks outside playing instruments and laying on a blankest enjoying some quite time

data.title: nice place
data.text: it was awesome in the evening everyone gathered there for some pleasant time. i went there last week with my girlfriend the shops over there were unbelievable. lots of bars pizza places and fun

data.title: Interesting
data.text: Enjoyed my visit.  Loved learning about Denton.  When I was there, there was a quilt exhibition.  Beautiful work.

data.title: A beautiful old lady full on interesting information.
data.text: What a classic to still be able to enter and walk the halls of this grand old courthouse build back in the days when they didnt use plastic and Chinese sheetrock. The museum is very interesting and the Commissioners Court on the second floor is worth the stair climb.

data.title: Fun downtown stop
data.text: I brought my grandkids for a quick visit to see the historic structure. However, I was disappointed to find out they had walled off the old jail cell that used to be in the basement.  That must have happened a while ago because the security guard was completely unaware it had ever been there.

data.title: Beautifully Preserved County Courthouse
data.text: The Courthouse on the Square Museum is located in the heart of the history Denton County Courthouse.  People visit nearly every day to enjoy the exterior of the building or relax in the shade on the surrounding lawn.  The museum displays artifact, photos, and documents from the founding of Denton through the present day.  It is worth visiting to see the interior of the restored 1896 Courthouse itself.  There are still a few offices in use but most of the building these days is the museum and the rest is open for visitors.  There are self-guided and guided tours available. (Best to book guided tours in advance.)

data.title: A good place to take photos
data.text: I went with some friends. There are not to much things to do there, but you can take good photos inside.

data.title: Spacious, Very Detailed
data.text: Extremely detailed with tons of little artifacts and surprisingly good photographs. Great place to visit while on the Square.

data.title: Great place to meet and greet!
data.text: An old time courthouse square in downtown Denton. Good folks! A place to walk, look and eat! A student neighborhood and full of life.
